thread.title: Jolly LLB 2 producer withdraws SC petition, says it has accepted Bombay HC order on cuts
thread.title_full: Jolly LLB 2 producer withdraws SC petition, says it has accepted Bombay HC order on cuts

title: Jolly LLB 2 producer withdraws SC petition, says it has accepted Bombay HC order on cuts

organizations.name: indian express online media pvt ltd

text:
Jolly LLB 2 producer withdraws SC petition, says it has accepted Bombay HC order on cuts Jolly LLB 2 producer withdraws SC petition, says it has accepted Bombay HC order on cuts The bench passed the order after the three-member committee, appointed by the high court to review the film, said the content of the film were defamatory” to the lawyers’ profession. By: Express Web Desk | New Delhi | Updated:  43 pm A still from Jolly LLB 2. (Representational) 
The producers of Akshay Kumar starring Jolly LLB 2, Fox Star Audio India, on Tuesday, has withdrawn its plea from Supreme Court against Bombay High Court order which asked the filmmakers to remove four controversial scenes from the film. The producers of the film said that they have agreed the four cuts in the film ordered by the High Court. 
The three-member committee appointed by the high court to review the film said the content of the film is “defamatory” to lawyers and constitutes as “contempt of court”. The division bench, headed by Justice S S Shinde passed the order on Monday after the committee’s review of the film. Nanded-based advocate Ajay Kumar Waghmare had filed a plea in the court, saying that the film portrays the legal system in the country in a bad light, following which, Fox Star India had moved to the Supreme Court. 
A Jaipur court, meanwhile, has also summoned actors Akshay Kumar and Annu Kapoor and Jolly LLB 2 director Subhash Kapoor, after a petition was filed by a Jaipur advocate Tikam Chand Sarma, accusing them of ridiculing the lawyer community through the movie. Additional Chief Metropolitan Magistrate Ashok Sen, after hearing the plea, said that the it appears the accused intentionally filmed dialogues which hurt prestige of the court and lawyers. A case has been registered under IPC’s Section 500 (defamation) and the court has summoned the three actors on March 3. © The Indian Express Online Media Pvt Ltd
